projectName.title: Project Name
projectName.description: Choose a name for your project. This will be used as the directory name and package name.
tips: Use lowercase letters, numbers, and hyphens
Keep it short and descriptive
Avoid spaces and special characters
Examples: my-app, todo-list, awesome-project

stack.title: Stack Selection
stack.description: Choose the technology stack for your project.

nextjs.name: Next.js
nextjs.description: Full-stack React framework with server components and API routes
nextjs.best_for: Web apps, marketing sites, dashboards, SEO-focused sites

t3.name: T3 Stack
t3.description: Type-safe full-stack Next.js with tRPC, Prisma, and NextAuth
t3.best_for: Apps requiring database and authentication with end-to-end type safety

vite.name: React + Vite
vite.description: Lightning-fast React SPA development with Vite
vite.best_for: Single-page applications, admin dashboards, client-side apps

mern.name: MERN Stack
mern.best_for: Full-stack CRUD apps, REST APIs, MongoDB-based projects

typescript.title: TypeScript
typescript.description: TypeScript adds static typing to JavaScript, catching errors before runtime.
tips: TypeScript is recommended for all projects
Provides better IDE support and autocomplete
Catches bugs early in development
Makes refactoring safer and easier
pros: Type safety - catch errors before runtime

styling.title: Styling Framework
styling.description: Choose how you want to style your application.

tailwind.name: Tailwind CSS
tailwind.description: Utility-first CSS framework for rapid UI development
tailwind.best_for: Most projects, especially prototypes and MVPs

css-modules.name: CSS Modules
css-modules.description: Scoped CSS with local class names

styled-components.name: Styled Components
styled-components.description: CSS-in-JS library for styled React components

packageManager.title: Package Manager
packageManager.description: Choose which package manager to use for dependencies.

npm.name: npm
npm.description: Node Package Manager (default, comes with Node.js)

pnpm.name: pnpm
pnpm.description: Fast, disk space efficient package manager

yarn.name: Yarn
yarn.description: Fast, reliable package manager by Facebook

shadcn.title: shadcn/ui
shadcn.description: Beautiful, accessible React components built with Radix UI and Tailwind CSS.
tips: Components are copied into your project (not a dependency)
Fully customizable - you own the code
Built on Radix UI for accessibility
Styled with Tailwind CSS
shadcn.best_for: Projects that need beautiful UI components quickly

git.title: Git Initialization
git.description: Initialize a Git repository and create an initial commit.
tips: Recommended for all projects
Required for deployment to Vercel/Netlify
Makes version control easier
Enables collaboration
what_happens: Creates initial commit with all files

auth.title: Authentication Providers
auth.description: Add authentication to your Next.js project with popular providers.

clerk.name: Clerk
clerk.description: Modern authentication with beautiful pre-built UI components
clerk.best_for: Projects that need auth quickly with minimal setup

supabase.name: Supabase
supabase.description: Open-source Firebase alternative with auth, database, and storage
supabase.best_for: Full-stack apps needing auth + database + storage in one
pros: Auth + PostgreSQL database + Storage in one platform
Row Level Security (RLS) for data protection

nextauth.name: NextAuth.js
nextauth.description: Flexible authentication library designed for Next.js
nextauth.best_for: Custom auth flows and maximum flexibility

tips: Clerk is the easiest for quick MVPs and prototypes
Supabase is great when you need database + auth together
NextAuth gives you the most control and flexibility
All providers work with Next.js App Router
